channel.title: Which is better? Enforcer or Sage?
channel.description: Read the title : ^) Ok thx bye

item.title: Which is better? Enforcer or Sage?
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Sage lets you kill with poison early AND has WoF to deal with prince ect. Enforcer just has Frenzy (which to be fair is very useful).

Enforcer is best late game where you just need to secure a few specific kills rather than getting as many kills as possible

Read full topic

item.title: Which is better? Enforcer or Sage?
item.dc:creator: SimpleValueDeskFan
item.description:
Basically

Sage has more kill potential with WoF and swapping protectives while also having the ability to confirm themselves and protect Unseen

Enforcer comes with 2 100% kills but knight claim lul and his second ability possible outing unseen

I’ll take Sage thank you very much

item.source: Which is better? Enforcer or Sage?

item.title: Which is better? Enforcer or Sage?
item.dc:creator: Tangeld
item.description:
Pretty easily the Sage.

Enforcer has one use of Frenzy, for a guaranteed kill, and three visit preventions against Unseen members (which becomes pretty sketchy if Enforcer dies and someone’s had visit prevention on them for a couple of nights now).

Sage on the other hand has two uses of Wall of Fire (which does everything Frenzy does except bypass immunity and those handful of effects that bypass WoF, mainly other visit prevention abilities on target or empowered Supports), and three uses of Tornado which can serve both offensively (swap a kill target away from protections) or defensively (swap an Unseen member away from their own death or investigation in addition to making the Sage look like they could still be CW). Not to mention that Sage Tornadoes can actually give the Assassin occ immunity.

Read full topic
item.source: Which is better? Enforcer or Sage?

item.title: Which is better? Enforcer or Sage?
item.dc:creator: SimpleValueDeskFan
item.description:
Enforcer makes your chances of hitting a target almost 100% [enforcer can be occ’d and assassin can still be redirected]

Sage targets can still target themselves, assassin can be occ’d and redirected, they can be healed or night immune [healed in the case of cw empower] - and probably more

In their second abilities sage has confirmability to make them seems like their old class and can move MM
if an enforcer dies then any recent prevents become susp

Read full topic
